intro: Euphrasia peduncularis, commonly known as the clustered eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has hairy, oval-shaped leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Euphrasia peduncularis is often found in meadows and along the edges of woodlands.
